div1.head: Military Orders for Thomas M. England and Charles G. Sonntag, January 12, 1901
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, January 12, 1901.

1. Upon the recommendation of the Chief Surgeon of the
Department, privates Thomas M. England and Charles G.
Sonntag, Hospital Corps, U. S. Army, are hereby relieved
from duty at Columbia Barracks, Cuba, and will report to
Major Walter Reed, Surgeon, U. S. Army, at Camp Lazear
(experimental camp), Quemados, for temporary duty.

2. Lieutenant Colonel Francis Moore, 10th Cavalry, will
proceed from Manzanillo to Puerto Príncipe Cuba, for the
purpose of investigating certain affairs existing at that post
which have this day been specially communicated to him
in correspondence by the Department Commander.

Upon completion of the duty assigned him, Lieutenant
Colonel Moore will return to his proper station.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:
